title: markers defined in pytest.ini or pyproject.toml are not considered. It does work when using the command line
body:
# problem

When I use markers in `pyproject.toml` or in `pytest.ini`, all tests are selected.

`pyproject.toml` (I make sure to delete pytest.ini when this config was tested)
```
[tool.pytest.ini_options]
pythonpath = "."
addopts = "--strict-markers"
markers = [
    "slow: mark a test that takes a long time to run.",
]
```

> platform darwin -- Python 3.10.11, pytest-7.4.3, pluggy-1.3.0
> rootdir: /Users/datategy/Documents/o2_ml
> configfile: pyproject.toml
> plugins: fugue-0.8.7, anyio-4.2.0
> collected 3 items

`pytest.ini`
```
[pytest]
pythonpath = .
addopts = --strict-markers
markers =
    slow
```

> platform darwin -- Python 3.10.11, pytest-7.4.3, pluggy-1.3.0
> rootdir: /Users/datategy/Documents/o2_ml
> configfile: pytest.ini
> plugins: fugue-0.8.7, anyio-4.2.0
> collected 3 items

However, when I try with the command line, it works perfectly and only select the tests marked with 'slow'

```
pytest -m slow
```

> platform darwin -- Python 3.10.11, pytest-7.4.3, pluggy-1.3.0
> rootdir: /Users/datategy/Documents/o2_ml
> configfile: pyproject.toml
> plugins: fugue-0.8.7, anyio-4.2.0
> collected 3 items / 2 deselected / 1 selected

# my test

```python
@pytest.mark.slow
@pytest.mark.parametrize("params_model", params_slow_model)
def test_slow_ts_forecasting(params_model):
    ...
```

# environment

python 3.10.11
pytest 7.4.3
Chip Apple M2
MacOS 13.2 (22D49)
